meanings.definition: Close to the actual value, but not completely accurate.
meanings.sent1: The approximative measurement of the table was almost correct.
meanings.sent2: Her approximative guess about the number of candies in the jar was close.
meanings.sent3: The approximative map led them to the wrong street, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His approximative memory of the event made it seem more dramatic than it was.
meanings.sent5: The approximative shadow of the tree looked like a giant monster in the dark.

meanings.definition: Serving to make an estimate or guess.
meanings.sent1: The approximative tool helped him calculate the distance quickly.
meanings.sent2: She used an approximative formula to predict the outcome of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The approximative scale made weighing ingredients a breeze in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His approximative method of budgeting saved time and effort.
meanings.sent5: The approximative weather forecast warned of possible rain later in the day.

meanings.sent1: The approximative answer he gave was not entirely correct.
meanings.sent2: Her approximative drawing captured the essence of the scene, despite some errors.
meanings.sent3: The approximative clock in the waiting room always ran a few minutes fast.
meanings.sent4: His approximative directions led them to the general area, but not the exact spot.
meanings.sent5: The approximative description of the painting left room for interpretation.
